ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: it was primarily live virtual lectures and small break out rooms. In addition, we had required readings for our discussion posts.
We also had virtual field trips and guest speakers, which I really enjoyed.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to appreciate the health of the body. Before this class, I believed that the body was only a vessel for the mind, and that the health of the mind and the health of the body were independent of each other. It feels silly now to write that because I know now that that is completely wrong. I have also learned that no matter how healthy or comfortable you are, you can always improve. My posture has improved, my flexibility has improved. I have learned to never settle for discomfort. Whenever I feel tight or uncomfortable I do my best to change that state. By improving my physical health, I improved mental health as well. I feel happier and more content with myself. I was not in the greatest mindset this summer during the pandemic and this class has honestly improved my life so much.
I have a better awareness of my body. I've learned to read long texts.

I have gained a stronger appreciation for the human body, and how we can improvement our posture and movements through specific exercises and mental practices. We also studied the teachings of various choreographers and how they have influenced modern dance teachings.
I learned so much about the body and the relationship between the mind and the body. This course is incredibly relevant to daily life and how to take of yourself.
I learned how to live healthily. I learned the body's proper posture and how to prolong the body's longevity and health.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I love how we got to move during most of our classes. Dancing or moving in class always made me feel more energized and engaged. Our discussions were always fun (although they would of course have been much better in-person). My only issue with this class is that it sometimes felt like a pseudo science. As in subjective opinions were discussed much more than objective fact. I understand, however, that this is not a science class, and it may just be the STEM major in me that makes me feel this way.
Great professor and interesting topics.

A main weakness is the inability to truly practice dances and movements due to the limitations of our dorm size. Under normal conditions we would have a whole dance studio to move and interact with our students: something that is impossible to do over zoom.

Strengths: Very fun, active, and very informative.
Weaknesses: A lot of the activities done in class had no or barely any connection to the reading, which made me feel like "Why did I read all that not to ever use it in this class?" Like, those readings were cool and sometimes really interesting (other times boring), but I would have appreciated if we used that knowledge more.
This course is very good at creating a sense of community. Everyone has a good time and seems to enjoy themselves in it.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved this class, but I was constantly reminded how much better it could have been in-person. All I know is that dancing a lot more fun when you can do it with a group of people in the same room than when you do it in separate rooms over zoom. It's a difficult problem because this is an inherently physical class. I don't have the solution and I think that professor MacArthur did the best job she could have in adapting this class to online.

The professor was very good at keeping students active. We had plenty of activities to keep everyone focused and engaged. However, the class can be disorganized at times and due dates can get confusing.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would highly recommend this class. As I said above, this class has helped me improve both my physical and mental health. This is the only online class where I was able to actually engage in conversation and feel connected with my peers. My only wish is that I could have taken this class in-person.
Yes. I feel like I've gained an understanding of my body and its movements, which I couldn't have gained in a COVID-19 setting without this course.
Yes 100%. It may be a little out of your comfort zone but it is very worth it. Not too much stress or work

I would recommend this course: especially to students who are solely taking STEM courses. It really pushes you out of your comfort zone and gain an appreciation for a subject area that you are not introduced to in high school.
Yes!! Please take this class, it's amazing and super fun!

I recommend this course to anybody, even if they're not too interested in anatomy, theater, or dance. This course really just teaches you how to take care of yourself. It's a subject that's very useful, especially in college.
